item.title: May 11 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: The Taurus is under the planetary rule Venus, but as you were born in the third Decan, or part, of the sign, you also receive a generous helping of Saturn's planetary influence. While it is Venus, the planet of harmony, that links to your sociability and warmth, it is Saturn, the planet of control, that explains for your discipline, order, patience and perseverance. Your unique combination of planetary influence makes you the most disciplined of all the Taurus Decans.

item.title: Oyetola To Know Fate In Disqualification Suit On Thursday
item.description: The Governor of Osun State and candidate of the All Progressives Congress in the July 16th governorship election, Gboyega Oyetola will know his fate on Thursday in a disqualification suit filed against him before the Federal High Court in Abuja. Justice Inyang Ekwo on Wednesday fixed the case for Thursday after counsel for the parties adopted their processes and presented their arguments in the matter. A chieftain of the party, Moshood Adeoti, through his legal team led by Chiesonu Okpoko (SAN), had filed the suit against Oyetola.

item.title: Why Did Jennifer Aniston Get Oil Thrown on Her? What to Know

item.title: How Youths And Women Can Break Into Politics In Nigeria
item.description: The Ondo State Governor, Rotimi Akeredolu has told youths in Nigeria that the older generation may not hand over political power to them willingly. He told the youths to ignore the current domination of the older generation in the country’s politics and intentionally get involved in politics and governance. Akeredolu submitted that without their active participation, there is no way they can be relevant in Nigeria’s politics. The Governor made the submission while speaking at the Ondo State Progressive Youth Stakeholders Round-Table Discussion held at the International Culture and Event Centre, in Akure, the state capital, on Tuesday.

EFCC recovers huge cash in ex-NNPC GMD's secret bunker
item.description: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) has recovered $9.8million in cash from a secret bunker owned by Dr. Andrew Yakubu who is a former Group Managing Director of the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation. According to a post the EFCC, the discovery was made on February 3 in a building belonging to Yakubu which is located in the slums of Sabon Tasha area of Kaduna. The anti-graft agency the former NNPC GMD confessed that the money was his and that it was given to him by unnamed persons.

2023: There Will Be No Kingmakers In APC
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has warned chieftains of the All Progressives Congress (APC) against anointing candidates or appointing roles to members. Buhari gave the warning on Thursday in an interview with the National Television Authority (NTA) and monitored by Naija News. Ahead of the 2023 general elections, the President stated that there will no kingmaker or godfather roles in the ruling party and will not tolerate such. The Nigerian leader advised aspirants seeking elective positions to embark on a massive campaign and let the people decide their candidate.

item.title: Bandits Shoot Pregnant Woman, Abduct Three People In Abuja
item.description: Gunmen suspected to be bandits have attacked Kwaita community in Kwali Area Council of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), shot a pregnant woman, and abducted three persons. According to Daily Trust, the gunmen stormed the community around 11 pm on Wednesday, shot sporadically, and kidnapped the victims. According to the report, the pregnant woman was hit by a stray bullet during the incident. It was gathered that the bandits invaded the houses of their victims and whisked them away.

item.title: You Lied, Your Appointments Unfair, Divisive
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has claimed that President Muhammadu Buhari is only trying to divert attention from calls for restructuring with his comments on appointments. Naija News reports that Buhari on Monday said that he has been fair and inclusive with his appointments and policies. Speaking in Abuja at a conference organised for youths in the All Progressives Congress (APC), Buhari denied allegations of nepotism and lopsided appointments. Represented by the Secretary to the Government of the Federation (SGF), Boss Mustapha, the president said all the regions have been impacted positively.

item.title: Senate Approves Six Additional Law School Campuses (See Locations)
item.description: The Senate on Tuesday approved the creation of six additional campuses of the Nigerian Law School by passing a bill that seeks to increase the number of Law School campuses in the country from six to twelve. This follows the adoption of the recommendation of the Senator Opeyemi Bamidele led Senate Committee on Judiciary, Human Rights, and Legal Matters that considered the Bill. The report of the committee was presented on Tuesday during plenary.

item.title: Analysis: Uhuru Has Ensured Ukambani Remains In Government Despite Rejecting Him
item.description: The region enjoys a huge presence in government despite opposing Uhuru’s presidential bids in 2013 and 2017It has produced Cabinet Secretaries, Permanent Secretaries, CASs, envoys and state corporation headsUkambani has also benefitted from mega-development projects, among them Konza City and Thwake DamPundits say Uhuru’s dalliance with Ukambani has validated his inclusivity bid and desire to develop Kenya evenlyPAY ATTENTION: Help us change more lives, join TUKO.co.ke’s Patreon programme In both the 2013 and 2017 general elections, the Ukambani region overwhelmingly voted for the opposition wing led by Raila Odinga.

item.title: Ekiti Governor-elect, Oyebanji Meets Fayose In Lagos [Photos]
item.description: The Ekiti State Governor-elect, Biodun Abayomi Oyebanji, on Wednesday met with former Governor Ayodele Fayose at his Lagos residence. Naija News reports that Oyebanji was the governorship candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in the Ekiti election held two weeks ago. Recall that Oyebanji, a former Secretary to the State Government (SSG), gathered 187,057 votes to defeat Fayose’s candidate, Bisi Kolawole of the Peoples Democratic Party, who gathered 67,457 votes.

item.title: June 12: Anenih to open up on his role
item.description: - The controversy surrounding the annulment of the 1993 presidential election still reverberates around Nigeria - National Chairman of the then Social Democratic Party (SDP), Chief Tony Anenih has opened up on his role  - Anenih's testimony is contained in his new book to be launched tomorrow, November 26 The former chairman, Board of Trustees of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Chief Tony Anenih has broken his silence of over two decades in his role in the annulment of the 1993 presidential election.

item.title: Oyebanji's Victory Was A Result Of His Popularity
item.description: The National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress, (APC) Senator Abdullahi Adamu has reacted to the emergence of Biodun Oyebanji, as the Governor-elect of Ekiti State. Adamu said Oyebanji’s victory was the result of the popularity of his candidature as well as the strong campaign strategies put in place by the ruling APC. The APC national chairman asserted that the victory was a precursor to the expected victories of the APC in the forthcoming Osun governorship election and at the 2023 general elections.

item.description: The federal government has come under more fire over its threat to impose a state of emergency on Anambra over insecurity in the state. Coming few weeks before the November 6 governorship polls in the state, the matter has continued to generate heated reactions and knocks for the federal government. Former presidential media aide, Reno Omokri has also questioned the decision by the federal government to overlook some troubled states such as Niger, Zamfara, and others but threaten Anambra State.

item.title: Narcis Monturiol - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Spanish intellectual, artist and engineer who invented the world's first submarine that could stay submerged with its own air supply. He made his first dives with his sub, which was named Ictineo I, during the summer of 1859. Before Fame He attained a law degree in Barcelona in 1845 but never practiced law. Trivia He was not the first person to invent a submarine, but he did create the first fully functional one, which he he hoped would be used to help Spanish divers find coral.

item.title: The Story of Why the Original Darrin Left 'Bewitched' Is So Tragic
item.description: Have you ever wondered why did Dick York left ‘Bewitched’? The story of the original Darrin's parting from the show is actually quite tragic. Source: gettyIt's always jarring when a show recasts a familiar character with a new actor, but it's been done since the early days of television for myriad reasons. One of the most memorable recastings in TV history is also one of the oldest: the two Darrins of Bewitched.

item.title: What Happened to Carolyn Bryant? Here's What We Know
item.description: Carolyn Bryant, the woman whose lies led to the murder of Emmett Till, seemingly disappeared. What happened to Carolyn Bryant? This is what we know. In 1955, after being accused of flirting with a white woman (Carolyn Bryant), 14-year-old Emmett Till was beaten to death by Carolyn's husband Roy and his half-brother J.W. Milam. Emmett was a Black boy visiting family in Mississippi. The two men, also white, were acquitted of this heinous and brutal crime.

item.title: APC Lists Projects Amaechi Attracted To Rivers
item.description: The Rivers State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) has condemned Governor Nyesom Wike over his statement against the former Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi. Governor Wike on Monday while commissioning a remodelled former RivBank Building in Port Harcourt had accused Amaechi of blocking projects that should have come to the state. The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Governor described Amaechi as a failure who no longer has access to the Aso Villa in Abuja.

item.title: PDP House Of Representatives Member To Be Punished For Calling For Buhari's Impeachment
item.description: The leadership of the House of Representatives has threatened to take disciplinary action against Kingsley Chinda, the lawmaker who is spearheading the impeachment process of President Muhammadu Buhari. This development was made known by House Leader, Hon. Ado Doguwa who noted that Chinda is acting in a personal capacity as his calls do not represent the views of the House, his constituency, or his party. Naija News reports Honourable Chinda, who represents Obio/Akpor Federal Constituency in Rivers State is the leader of the Peoples Democratic Party, caucus in the House of Reps.

item.title: Vanderpump Rules Fan Memes About Tom, Ariana, and Raquel Drama
item.description: Tom Sandoval and Ariana Madix from 'Vanderpump Rules' ended their nine-year relationship. Tom cheated on Ariana with Raquel Leviss and memes ensued. On Friday, March 3, 2023, the weekend began with nearly every Bravo fan discussing the latest scandal to hit Vanderpump Rules. While it certainly wasn’t the first time Lisa Vanderpump’s hit workplace reality drama has made headlines, Friday’s scandal shook longtime viewers to their core, with many blaming Tom Sandoval and Raquel Leviss.

item.title: Why Did Cynthia Bailey and Peter Thomas Divorce? She Later Sued Him
item.description: Cynthia Bailey and Peter Thomas divorced after getting married on 'The Real Housewives of Atlanta.' See why they split up and why she sued him. Although she’s happily married to Mike Hill, Cynthia Bailey says she still misses one thing about her ex-husband, Peter Thomas. The former Real Housewives of Atlanta star married the restauranteur in 2010. After tying the knot on the show, they shared the highs and lows of their marriage.

item.title: 2023: Wike, Ortom, Others Won't Put Atiku, PDP At Risk
item.description: The former spokesman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Kola Ologbondiyan, on Wednesday, dismissed the claims that the Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike, will put the party and its presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar at risk. Ologbondiyan, while speaking on the crisis rocking the PDP, said he is confident that Wike would not take steps that would hinder Atiku from winning in 2023. The PDP Chieftain also noted that the Governor of Benue State, Samuel Ortom and the Abia State Governor, Okezie Ikpeazu, who have senatorial ambitions, would also work in favour of the party.

item.title: Explosion In Abuja Leaves Scores Killed And Many Injured (Photos & Video UPDATED)
item.description: Pandemonium struck this morning in the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja when an explosion rocked an outskirt of the city and according to reports, scores of people were killed and hundreds injured in the incident. Latest reports from authorities confirmed that the blast actually took place at the Abuja urban mass transport company limited garage under the bridge at Nyanya. This is contrary to earlier reports that the explosion sounded in an unnamed highly populated motor park less than five minutes drive from the Abuja city centre.

item.title: Louisiana | Famous Birthdays
item.description: The state of Louisiana is located in the deep American South. It is bordered by the Gulf of Mexico to its south. In terms of population Louisiana is the 25th most populous. Its largest metropolitan area is that of Greater New Orleans. The state's official mammal is the black bear. Louisiana and Missouri were originally one state prior to their separation in 1812.  Trivia Louisiana is home to the New Orleans Saints and the New Orleans Pelicans.

item.title: People Share the 'Incidents' That Were Big News in Their High Schools
item.description: People Share the 'Incidents' That Became Legendary in Their High SchoolsBy Robin ZlotnickMar. 10 2020, Updated 4:00 p.m. ET Source: New World PicturesEveryone had that incident in high school. You know what I'm talking about. My high school had that senior who was definitely dating the gym teacher. There was also the time the seniors released thousands of crickets one year as a prank, and the murder that happened years before behind the track in the woods.

item.title: Cute relationship memes for all kinds of couples
item.description: One of the most helpful ways of getting over the bad times in a relationship is by sharing some funny relationship memes with your partner. Even those in a long-distance relationship can enjoy exciting funny dating memes which they can relate with easily. Despite the ups and downs in life, couples can still enjoy light moments together by sharing wholesome love memes that are all over the internet. Some of these jokes are available on social media sites like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, where partners in love can tag each other.

item.title: The Defining Attribute That Makes Ryan Murphy Characters Captivating
item.description: Why Are Ryan Murphy Characters So Intoxicating? A Deep DiveBy Joshua LezmiPublished Aug. 30 2021, 11:07 a.m. ET Source: NetflixRyan Murphy is a groundbreaking creator in Hollywood: a force who has brought female and queer representation to the forefront of TV to not only be watched but worshipped. Via the likes of Scream Queens, The Politician, Hollywood, American Horror Story, and more, he has proven that those formerly pushed to the fringes of the frame have stories worth telling, worth hearing.

item.title: These 'Twilight' TikToks Are Better Than the Movie Franchise
item.description: 'Twilight' TikTok threads on Twitter are taking over the internet for their hilarious recreations of this awesomely bad vampire movie franchise. Source: Summit EntertainmentVine died in 2016 (R.I.P) and ever since, we’ve been trying to find something to fill the 6-second hole of boredom in our hearts. Luckily, cool internet teens have led us to the video app TikTok. Think of it as a much longer-form Vine with weirder videos and wilder meme trends.

item.title: Tinubu, Ngige, Others Attend Aisha Buhari's Ramadan Iftar Dinner For 2023 Presidential Aspirants
item.description: Some of the 2023 presidential aspirants arrived early at the Old Banquet Hall of the Presidential Villa, Abuja for the Ramadan Iftar dinner organized by First Lady Aisha Buhari. The event which was scheduled to kick off by 6.30 pm already had some of the guests arriving by 6.20 pm. Some of the presidential aspirants who arrived early and were on seat when the event started include the National Leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Asiwaju Bola Tinubu; Minister of Labour and Employment, Senator Chris Ngige, Governor Dave Umahi of Ebonyi and his Bauchi State counterpart, Bala Mohammed.

item.title: Volunteers to Be Injected with the Coronavirus to Help Find a Vaccine
item.description: UK Researchers Offering $4.6K and Unlimited Video Games to Get Infected With CoronavirusBy Robin ZlotnickUpdated March 9 2020, 11:32 a.m. ET Source: Lionsgate FilmsDo you volunteer as tribute? Researchers in the UK are currently looking for volunteers to offer to be infected with a coronavirus and held in quarantine to help them find a vaccine more quickly. According to Newshub, these volunteers will be paid £3,500 (about $4,600) for their time and effort.

item.title: Austin Pamajewon - Age, Family, Bio
Check out Who's Joining the Cast of 'SNL' for Season 47 (and Who's Leaving)
item.description: The newest season of 'Saturday Night Live' is just around the corner. Here are the new faces of the cast and veterans who are saying goodbye. Source: NBCThe latest season of Saturday Night Live is on track for its fall premiere on October 2. NBC's long-running late-night comedy sketch series is set to enter Season 47, and of course, it's welcoming some new cast members. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, the series saw a major paradigm shift over the past two years.

item.title: Chef Dammy Has Now Made An Application
item.description: The Guinness World Records has acknowledged the application of the 120-hours cook-A-Thon of Nigerian chef, Damilola Adeparusi, popularly known as Chef Dammy. Naija News recalls that the chef began cooking on Friday, June 9 in Oye-Ekiti with a 120 hours cooking time goal. On Wednesday morning, Adeparusi hit her target of 120 hours of cooking amid jubilation from folks and criticisms from others. In response to an inquiry, GWR on Wednesday, June 14, maintained that the chef did not seek their approval before beginning the cook-A-Thon as there are procedures and rules which would have been sent to her to follow.

item.title: Jamaa asimamisha harusi akidai bi harusi ni mpenziwe na alimpachika mimba
item.description: - Sherehe za harusi zilisambaratika huku waliohudhuria wakisalia kinywa wazi - Jamaa mmoja alijitokeza na kumwagiza pasta kuisimamisha harusi hiyo - Alidai kwamba bi harusi alikuwa mpenziwe kwa muda na wakati huo wa harusi, mwanamke huyo alikuwa na mimba yake Pakua APP mpya ya TUKO upate habari BURE! Jamaa moja ambaye jina lake tumelibana alikuwa chanzo cha kuharibika kwa sherehe za harusi zilizopamba moto katika eneo moja humu nchini. Ingawa bibi Na bwana harusi walikuwa wamejitayarisha kuapa na kufurahia maisha yao ya ndoa, adui wa uhusiano huo alifika tayari kuusambaratisha.

item.title: Lawan Opens Up On N/Asembly Collecting $10 million Bribe To Pass PIB
item.description: Senate President Ahmed Lawan has denied a report that the National Assembly members collected a $10 million bribe to pass the controversial Petroleum Industry Bill (PIB). Lawan made the denial on Monday in an interview with State House correspondents after meeting President Muhammadu Buhari at the Presidential, Villa Abuja. Recall that the Nigerian leader signed the controversial bill into law as confirmed in a statement last week Monday by his spokesman, Femi Adesina.

item.title: Buhari Is A Disappointment, He Has Not Changed
item.description: The General Overseer of the Citadel Global Community Church, formerly known as Latter Rain Assembly, Pastor Tunde Bakare, has said President Muhammadu Buhari has disappointed Nigerians. Speaking in an Instagram Live interview with Chief Dele Momodu, the former Vice-Presidential candidate said Buhari has not met the expectations of Nigerians. The cleric said there is a general feeling of disappointment among Nigerians who expected change, adding that Buhari is still the same person and has not been changed by power.

item.title: Economic Hardship Only Temporary, Reforms Yielding Positive Results
item.description: The Federal Government has promised Nigerians that the economic hardship felt across the country will only be temporary. The Minister Of Information and National Orientation, Mohammed Idris, made the promise during a ministerial press briefing in Abuja on Wednesday. According to the minister, the reforms and measures adopted by the Bola Tinubu ad­ministration to cure structural dislocations in the economy be­gin to yield results. He said the reforms of the government have already begun to yield positive results as seen in the GDP growth of 3.

item.title: Kenyan newspapers review for September 30: Uhuru altered speech on school reopening, threw education
item.description: The dailies on Wednesday, September 30, widely reported on the escalating rift between President Uhuru Kenyatta and his deputy, William Ruto, following the latter's decision to snub the national COVID-19 conference. The dailies also reported on the president's last minute decision to keep primary and secondary schools shut despite having been advised by education officials to reopen. READ ALSO: Key road projects across Kenya that are shaping Uhuru Kenyatta’s legacy

item.title: Mr Ibu's Son, Daughter Arrested For Allegedly Misappropriating N55 Million Donated To Help Ailing Ac
item.description: The Nigerian Police, operating through its Force Criminal Investigation and Intelligence Department (FCID) in Alagbon, Ikoyi, Lagos State, has announced the apprehension of Oyeabuchi Daniel Okafor and Jasmine Chioma Okekeagwu. They were arrested on charges of conspiring and defrauding John Ikechukwu Okafor, also known as Mr. Ibu, of the sum of N55 million. In a press release issued on Thursday, the FCID revealed that it had acted upon a petition submitted by Diamond Waves Law on behalf of the actor’s wife, Stella Maris Chinyere Okafor.

item.title: What Happened to Newhouse on 'Chicago Fire?' Why Did he Disappear?
item.description: What happened to Newhouse on 'Chicago Fire?' Newhouse first appeared in Season 2 of 'Chicago Fire,' only to mysteriously disappear in Season 3. Over the years, the cast of Chicago Fire has undergone some seismic changes. Judging by the Season 10 premiere, the next batch of episodes could mark the end for characters like Chief Wallace Boden (Eamonn Walker) and Joe Cruz (Joe Minoso). Leslie Shay (Lauren German), Kevin Hadley (William Smillie), and Rick Newhouse (Edwin Hodge) are just some of the firefighters who vanished from the show.

item.title: Aisha Tyler - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress who appeared on the television series Ghost Whisperer and had a featured role on Friends. As a voice actor, she starred as Agent Lana Kane in Archer. Before Fame She was a member of an all-female acapella group while studying at Dartmouth College. Trivia She had a guest role as Wendy in Modern Family in 2014. Family Life She married Jeff Tietjens in 1994 but the couple separated in 2015. Associated With She appeared as a music critic on the show At the Movies with Ebert & Roeper, filling in for Roger Ebert.

item.title: APC & PDP Lawmakers Attack Each Other In Edo Assembly
item.description: The battle for supremacy in Edo House of Assembly entered its third day on Wednesday, June 11 as the lawmakers exchanged blows in public. Uyi Igbe, Speaker, Edo State House of Assembly There was a free for all fight in the assembly chambers between APC and PDP assemblymen which resulted in the smashing of some glass doors in the complex. According to report, the commotion started when nine members of the house who belong to the People Democratic Party, PDP, led by the suspended Deputy Speaker, Festus Ebea, enter the hallowed chamber for the day’s proceedings.

item.title: DP Ruto ataungwa mkono Mlima Kenya endapo "atatoa kitu", Ngunjiri Wambugu asema
item.description: - Mbunge wa Nyeri Town Ngunjiri Wambugu alidai William Ruto alitoa orodha ya matakwa mnamo 2012 aliyotaka yazingatiwe kabla ya kuungana na Rais Uhuru Kenyatta - Mbunge huyo wa Jubilee alishikilia katika siasa kila mmoja anahitaji kufaidika na hivyo basi na kwa hivyo DP anapaswa kushughulikia maslahi ya watu wa GEMA kabla ya kuomba uugwaji mkono - Naibu wa rais mara kadhaa amezuru eneo la Mlima Kenya kujenga misingi anapojiandaa kuwania urais wa taifa la Kenya kwa mara ya kwanza

item.title: Omah Lay Reveals His Relationship Status
item.description: Nigerian singer, Stanley Omah Didia, widely known as Omah Lay, has revealed that he is presently single and not searching. The artist mentioned that he has been unattached for a considerable period and clarified that he is not actively seeking a relationship. In a recent interview with The Beat FM in London, United Kingdom, Omah Lay explained that he intends to stay single for a while to concentrate on his career.

item.title: Adamawa Assembly Starts Impeachment Procedure Against Murtala Nyako
item.description: The Adamawa State House of Assembly has reportedly started the impeachment procedure against  governor Murtala Nyako and his deputy Bala Ngilari. According to Premium Times, the impeachment notice was directed to the two officials on Wednesday, June 18. The two politicians are accused in fraudulent divertion of N10bn of Adamawa state workers’ salaries for September and October 2011; N120m workers’ emolument for May 2014; N1.7bn for Special Assistants; and N8bn for fictitious contract.

item.title: Coco Jones - Age, Family, Bio
INEC Promise Conclusive Election In Ondo State
item.description: The Independent National Electoral Commission, (INEC), on Tuesday, assured that the governorship election in Ondo State will be conclusive and acceptable. The Ondo State Resident Electoral Commissioner, Rufus Akeju, stated this at the opening ceremony of a three-day advocacy and voter education training for youths in the state. Akeju noted that the electoral body is ready to conduct a free and fair election, that would be devoid of any form of malpractice during the October 10 polls.

item.title: Jim Jones (Rapper) - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Bronx-based rapper who released the #1 single "We Fly High" in 2006. He is one of the CEO's of Diplomat Records and his fifth studio album, Capo, was released in 2011. Before Fame He began his entertainment career as a hype man before being taken seriously as an MC. Trivia He is a member of the rap groups Dipset and ByrdGang. Family Life He began a relationship with reality star Chrissy Lampkin.

item.title: What Is the 'Alaskan Bush People' Accent? A Closer Look at the Unique Dialect
item.description: We Can't Quite Pinpoint the Browns' Accent on 'Alaskan Bush People'By Allison CacichUpdated May 26 2020, 5:18 p.m. ET Source: InstagramThere’s no word yet on whether Alaskan Bush People will return for a 12th season later this year, but as fans wait for news about the reality show, they've been binge-watching episodes from the Discovery Channel series’ early years. When the Brown family first popped up on our television screens in 2014, one of the biggest mysteries surrounding the adventurous clan was the origin of their hard-to-place accent.

item.title: Mohbad Tried To Commit Suicide Because Of Issues With Naira Marley Bella Shmurda
item.description: Nigerian singer, Akinbiyi Abiola Ahmed, popularly known as Bella Shmurda, has opened up on how his colleague, Mohbad tried to commit suicide because of the rift between him and his former record label, Marlian Music. Naija News recalls that Mohbad had called out Naira Marley last year on social media for allegedly sending his boys to beat him up. He left the record label shortly after the incident. Speaking in a chat with Chude Jideonwo, Shmurda said Mohbad attempted to commit suicide during his ordeal but was prevented by friends.

item.title: Protesters Storm APC Natl Secretariat Over Candidates Imposition
item.description: Some members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) on Friday stormed the national secretariat of the party in Abuja to protest against what they called alleged moves by some party bigwigs to impose National Working Committee (NWC) members on them at the March 26 national convention. The alleged move by some bigwigs in the All Progressives Congress to impose members of the National Working Committee has seen some aggrieved members of the party protest at the national secretariat of the party.

item.title: What Happens When Someone Falls Overboard?
item.description: Falling Overboard Happens Often on 'Deadliest Catch' — Here's How the Crew RespondsMany 'Deadliest Catch' crew members have been injured — and killed — after falling overboard. By Elizabeth RandolphPublished Aug. 6 2024, 2:18 p.m. ET Source: DiscoveryWith 20 seasons under its belt, Deadliest Catch keeps its fans on their toes. When they're not wondering if the crew what twists and turns will happen to the crew during the Alaskan crab season, fans are also keeping up with the personal crises the crew faces on and off the ship.

item.title: WWE announcers salary in 2021: Who is the highest paid?
item.description: In the present-day roster, WWE superstars make a ton of money in every wrestling match they participate in. However, they are not the only ones featured on the show. The show also features other on-air personalities, such as ring announcers. With the company offering big paychecks to top superstars, have you ever asked yourself how much the WWE announcers' salary is? WWE Wrestling is a worldwide sport that has become a phenomenon nowadays.

item.title: FG Issues Security Alert To Nigerians
item.description: The federal government has alerted the general public not to be scared by the noticeable increase in the level of security patrol and activities ahead of the October 1 independence day celebration. According to a statement in Abuja on Friday issued by the Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed, all is in order and there is no need for residents and citizens to panic. The statement, in particular, noted that there will be an obvious increase in security presence in the Federal Captial Territory (FCT), Abuja.

item.title: Mungai Mbaya's Girlfriend Aisha Says June and July Are Her Worst Months after Losing Child
item.description: Mungai Mbaya's girlfriend Aisha said June and July are her most stressful monthsAisha said she looked forwards to spend the months indoors breastfeeding, only for her son to dieThe young lady wondered what June and July 2022 would bringPAY ATTENTION: Help us change more lives, join TUKO.co.ke’s Patreon programme Aisha, the girlfriend of former Junction Juniors actor Mungai Mbaya, has termed June and July 2020 as her worst months. item.title: NASA coalition denies report Raila's luxury car among those impounded over tax evasion
item.description: - This was in response to report by a section of the media indicating Raila's car was impounded by detectives - The report claimed the vehicle was seized over fraudulent registration claims in tax evasion racket - Other 17 vehicles mentioned in the report belonged to politicians and government officials - Vehicles targeted by police include 64 Range Rovers, Mercedes Benz (94) and Toyotas (224) The National Super Alliance (NASA) coalition has dismissed reports that detectives from the Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) impounded ODM party leader Raila Odinga's luxurious car in an ongoing crackdown against tax evasion.

item.title: EFCC Arrests 48 KWASU Students Over Alleged Internet Fraud Activities
item.description: The Ilorin Zonal Command of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) has apprehended no fewer than 48 students from Kwara State University (KWASU) and two Malete residents over alleged involvement in Internet fraud, commonly known as Yahoo Yahoo. The anti-graft agency claimed the arrest was made following reliable intelligence on the increasing prevalence of internet fraud activities in the state, particularly within educational institutions. In an effort to combat corruption and illicit activities associated with yahoo-yahoo, the EFCC reportedly conducted thorough investigations, tracking down the suspects and apprehending them in various locations where they were hiding, following days of surveillance on Wednesday, February 21, 2024.

item.title: FIFA Bans Al-Nassr Over Nigeria's Ahmed Musa Transfer
item.description: Federation Internationale de Football Association (FIFA) has banned Saudi Arabia club, Al-Nassr from signing new players into the new Saudi Pro League. Naija News understands that the sanction was issued over an underlying issue involving Super Eagles captain, Ahmed Musa. Reports are that Al-Nassr failed to pay Leicester City the money they owed them over Musa’s transfer. It could be recalled that the Super Eagles star signed for the Saudi Arabian Pro League side in a €16.

item.title: Some Visitors Of Tinubu In Aso Rock Have Corruption Cases
item.description: A notable human rights lawyer, Femi Falana has advised President Bola Tinubu to take a stand against corruption. He expressed concern about high-profile politicians currently facing corruption charges, yet visiting the Presidential Villa. Falana voiced his concerns during a commemorative event in Ado-Ekiti, Ekiti State, on Monday, July 10, 2023, celebrating Aare Afe Babalola’s 60 years at the Bar. “Some of those who are going in and out of the Villa are standing trial for looting the treasury of this country,” he declared.

item.title: FERMA Begins Repair Of Abuja- Keffi Road Where Alex Badeh Was Killed
item.description: FERMA  Speaks On Repair Of Abuja-Keffi Road The Federal Road Maintenance Agency (FERMA) is carrying out thorough rehabilitation on some failed and critical portions of the Abuja-Keffi dual carriageway. Managing Director of the agency Engr. Nurudeen Rafindadi, stated this while inspecting ongoing repair works by his men from the Mogadishu Cantonment Bridge to Maraba stretch of the road. Recall that it was the same Abuja-Keffi road, that  Alex Badeh, a former chief of defence staff in Nigeria was recently murdered by gunmen.

item.title: Iheanacho Insists He Is Ready For Super Eagles Vs Ivory Coast Clash
item.description: Leicester City forward, Kelechi Iheanacho has insisted that he is ready for the Super Eagles 2023 AFCON group stage game against the hosts, Ivory Coast. Kelechi Iheanacho was seen training with the rest of the Super Eagles team ahead of the AFCON clash which will kick off at 6 p.m. on Thursday, January 18. Recall that Iheanacho was one of the last players to arrive at the Super Eagles AFCON camp in Abidjan, Ivory Coast due to fitness issues.

item.title: Senate President Mark Tells Kidnappers To Release School Girls.
item.description: Senate President David Mark said on Wednesday that the abduction of school girls in Borno State was a torture for the children's families and embarrassment for Nigeria. He demanded immediate release of the girls. Mark said this in a statement issued by his spokesperson, Paul Mumeh, Daily Trust reports. On April 14 more than 200 girls were kidnapped from the Government Girls Secondary School in Chibok by the suspected Boko Haram sect.

item.title: Steven Tyler Was Married Twice But He Had Plenty of Other Relationships, Too
item.description: Fans want to know if Steven Tyler is married as a sexual assault lawsuit is leveled against the Aerosmith singer. Source: Getty ImagesContent warning: This article contains mentions of sexual abuse against a minor. In light of the famed Aerosmith singer being accused of sexually assaulting a minor decades ago, fans are wondering: Is Steven Tyler married? And perhaps more top-of-mind for the band’s devotees is whether the “Dream On” crooner was married when the alleged illegal relationship took place.

Trivia She recreated Pop's Diner from Riverdale in Roblox. She posts lifestyle photos and selfies on her non-Roblox account, plantasticpanda. Her real name is Mochili. item.title: DStv packages in Nigeria: subscription prices and channels 2024
item.description: DStv is a leading satellite television operator in Africa. The MultiChoice-owned corporation is present in a number of African countries, Nigeria included. DStv packages in Nigeria give subscribers the freedom to settle for what they enjoy the most based on their financial capabilities. item.description: Marcus Smart Is Leaving the Celtics, But Why Did He Dye His Hair Green?By Joseph AllenPublished June 22 2023, 11:31 a.m. ET Source: Instagram/@yourgamechangerAfter almost a decade with the Boston Celtics, news recently broke that Marcus Smart was being traded to the Grizzlies as part of a three-way trade that allowed the Celtics to acquire Kristaps Porzingas from the Washington Wizards. Following the news that Marcus would be leaving the only team he's ever played for in the NBA, many wanted to know why Marcus had dyed his hair green in the past.

item.title: Buharis Son Appears In Public For The First Time
item.description: Yusuf, the son of the president-elect, Muhammadu Buhari, has appeared for the first time to the public, as he arrived in the country from the United Kingdom together with his father in the early hours of today, May 28. Yusuf is the son of Hajiya Aisha Halilu, the second wife of the president-elect. Buhari is divorced from his first wife Safinatu, with whom he had five children, and married Aisha, 44, in 1989.

item.title: Build-a-Bear Adds Massive, Adorable Snorlax Pokmon Plush That You Can Buy Now
item.description: Build-a-Bear is now selling a new Snorlax plush as part of a partnership with 'Pokémon: Sword' and 'Shield' that's large and in charge and very sleepy. Source: Pokémon / Build-a-BearI remember way back in the day when Build-a-Bear only had one teddy bear in like, three different colors that you could choose from. Maybe I'm dating myself, but things are different today, to say the least. The Build-a-Bear Workshop just released an adorable and huge Snorlax plushie just in time for the holidays.

item.description: Medical doctors under the aegis of the Nigerian Association of Resident Doctors (NARD) have embarked on an indefinite nationwide strike. item.title: APC Fixes Date For Emergency NEC Meeting
item.description: The leadership of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) has fixed March 17, 2022, for an emergency National Executive Council (NEC) meeting. This was made known in a circular of obtained by Naija News on Thursday. The circular reads, “Pursuant to Article 258 (i and ii) of the Party Constitution, and by the power vested on the Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) via the NEC resolution of 8th December 2020, the CECPC of the Party at its 23rd meeting of 8 March, 2022, hereby calls for the meeting of the National Executive Committee (NEC) of our great Party, the All Progressives Congress (APC) to consider matters pertaining to the National Convention, governance of the party and any other relevant business of the party.

item.title: First general manager of NAN Onuorah Nzekwu dies at 89
item.description: Onuorah Nzekwu, an author who wrote one of Nigeria's most popular novels for kids 'Eze goes to school' has died. News Agency of Nigeria reports that Nzekwu, the pioneer general manager of the agency, died on Friday, April 21. The death has been confirmed by his family, the report says. Nzekwu died by 4.30pm at his home in Onitsha, Anambra state, where he had been living in retirement, a family member Louis Chuke said.

item.description: The Nursing and Midwifery Council of Nigeria (NMCN)  has updated its guidelines for the verification of certificate(s) with the Nursing and Midwifery Council of Nigeria for practice abroad. The development was announced via a circular.

NTA," one person commented. By Mustafa GatollariUpdated May 7 2024, 3:48 p.m. ET Source: Getty Images;Reddit/@Dramatic_Safe_4257The price discrepancies between first-class seats are often exponentially different, especially when it comes to international flights. But let's say you want to have a little bit of extra room on the flight and don't mind paying extra for it, but you don't want to pay five or six times the cost of economy.

item.title: Supreme Court To Deliver Ruling On Secondus Appeal Tomorrow
item.description: The Supreme Court will tomorrow deliver judgement on the appeal filed by the sacked National Chairman of the PDP, Prince Uche Secondus, asking the apex court to quash his removal from office. Recall that the Appeal Court had on October, 29 struck out a suit filed by Secondus against the party’s national convention. Secondus, who is challenging his removal from office, had approached the appellate court in Port Harcourt, demanding it to restrain the PDP from holding its 2021 National Convention which was later held on October 30 and 31.

item.title: Yoruba Council Of Elders Blast Abdulsalami Over Claims On MKO Abiola's Death
item.description: Former Head of State, Gen Abdulsalami Abubakar‘s claim about the death of the winner of the June 12, 1993, presidential election in Nigeria, Moshood Abiola, has been questioned by the Yoruba Council of Elders (YCE). According to the Secretary-General of YCE, Kunle Olajide, the narrative of the former head of state is hard to believe. Recall that Abdulsalami in an interview with Daily Trust last week claimed that Abiola was not killed contrary to the speculations that he was poisoned.

item.title: APC To Kick Off Presidential Campaigns Oct 10
item.description: The ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) is expected to commence it presidential campaign for the 2023 general elections on the 10th of October, 2022. APC fixed the new date with expectations to receive the presidential candidate of the party, Bola Tinubu back to the country in the next few days. Recall that Tinubu travelled out of the country days before the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) announced the commencement of the presidential campaign season.

item.title: Ex-Kaduna Gov, Yero Joins APC, Gives Reason
item.description: Former Governor of Kaduna State, Muktar Ramalan Yero, has joined the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC), barely five months after leaving the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). The former governor, who served the state from 2012 to 2015 under PDP, said he, alongside others, joined APC based on the invitation they received from the party. Yero appealed to his supporters to join the ruling party to contribute their quota towards moving the state and country forward.

item.title: Types of population census and other useful information
item.description: In this article, we are going to discuss what is a census and what are the types of population census. So. let’s get started. What is a census and what kind of data is collected?Census is an enumeration of people or items in a particular country or area. This term is most often used to define the number of population. The word "census" comes from a Latin verb 'censere', it means - 'to assess', or, in terms of statistics, 'to estimate' (The Encyclopedia Americana, 1951).

item.title: Wizkid's Former Producer, Samklef Blasts Him, Says Fame Has Changed Him
item.description: Wizkid's ex-producer, Samclef has made shocking revelations on his hate for music sensation, Wizkid. Linda Ikeji reports that Wizkid has left the good books of his former producer, Samclef hence, the reason why the super producer is sad with him. The producer who produced Wizkid's hit single Tease Me and five other songs in Wizkid's first album, made it known that the superstar singer has not only refused to work with him again, but he goes about dirtying his good name.

item.title: EFCC Moves Against Rivers State Accountant General, 54 Others Over N435bn Fraud
item.description: The Economic Financial Crimes Commission(EFCC) has announced that it is in search of the Rivers State Accountant-General, Fubara Siminayi, alongside 54 others. Siminayi and 58 other persons were declared wanted over alleged N435 billion fraud. Wilson Uwujaren, the commission’s head of media and publicity, announced the development on Tuesday May 24. Uwujaren alerted the public to help the EFCC with useful information that will lead to the arrest of the suspects.

item.title: Famous Ohangla dancer killed by floods while trying to rescue her children
item.description: Celebrated Ohangla musician Abenny Jachiga is mourning death of his band member Vivian Awuor who drowned on Tuesday, April 23, following heavy rain in Nairobi. Vivian, a mother of two, left the children at her sister's house in Kibera for the Easter weekend and she had gone to pick them on that fateful evening when the tragedy struck on their way back home. Tinubu who won the All Progressives Congress (APC) presidential ticket for the 2023 general elections is currently puzzled about who and where to pick his running mate from, Naija News understands. item.title: Lagos Govt Closes Dowen College Indefinitely
item.description: Following the death of 12-year-old Sylvester Oromoni, the Lagos State Government has directed that Dowen College, Lekki be shut down indefinitely. item.title: CBN Lifts Restrictions On Domiciliary Accounts, Roles Out Six Guidelines
item.description: The Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) says cash deposits into domiciliary accounts will not be restricted, and customers “shall have unfettered and unrestricted access to funds in their accounts”. Naija News reports that the CBN disclosed this in a statement issued after a meeting with the bankers’ committee on Sunday. The bankers committee meeting was meant to provide further guidance to deposit money banks (DMBs) on the recent operational changes to the foreign exchange market and to discuss the implementation and implications of the policy changes for the banking public.

item.title: Daniel Ricciardo - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Formula One driver who won the Canadian Grand Prix in 2014, as well as the 2021 Italian Grand Prix. He placed third in the Mexican Grand Prix in 2016. In 2019, he began driving for Renault and in 2020, he signed with McLaren. Before Fame He began racing karts at age nine and entered Formula Ford in 2005. Trivia He is just the fourth Australian driver to win a Formula One Grand Prix.

item.title: Insecurity: Why NYSC Should Be For Two Years
item.description: Governor Darius Ishaku of Taraba State has revealed why the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) scheme should be a two-year programme. During an appearance on a programme on Channels Television on Wednesday, Ishaku extending the scheme will allow corps members can undergo military training. The Taraba governor said at the end of the military training, ex-corps members would be able to carry guns to defend themselves against bandits, insurgents, and other criminal elements.

item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today Saturday, 6th November 2021. The people make democracy tick. All over the world, activists, leaders of thought, and social crusaders go all out to see to it that their nation adopts democracy as a system of governance. item.title: Buhari Raises Alarm, Says Weapons From Russia-Ukraine War Are Now Shipped To Africa
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has raised an alarm over weapons proliferation in African countries. According to him, some weapons used in the lingering war between Russia and Ukraine are being shipped into the Lake Chad Basin region. Lake Chad region is an economically and socially integrated area in West and Central Africa straddling Cameroon, Chad, Niger, and Nigeria. Naija News reports that the Nigerian leader raised the alarm while delivering a speech at the 16th Summit of the Heads of State and Government of the Lake Chad Basin Commission (LCBC), held at the Conference Hall of the Presidential Villa, Abuja, on Tuesday.

item.title: APC Government Has Failed - Solomon Dalung
item.description: The former sports minister and a leading figure in Nigeria’s ruling All Progressives Congress (APC), Solomon Dalung, has said his party is not as concerned about the security situation in the country as it is about winning the 2023 election. He made the remarks in an interview with the BBC Hausa Service. Barrister Solomon Dalung said the government of President Muhammadu Buhari have focused on overcoming insecurity. According to the former Minister, the present administration should focus on the issue of leadership, such as the plight of the Nigerian masses.

item.title: Bandits Kidnap Niger Commissioner (Photo)
item.description: Gunmen suspected to be bandits have kidnapped the Niger State Commissioner of Information, Alhaji Sani Idris. The Secretary to the State Government, Alhaji Ahmed Ibrahim Matane, made this known to reporters on Monday in Minna, the state capital. Matane noted that his colleague was kidnapped around 1:00 am at his hometown, Baban Tunga in Tafa Local Government Area of the state. He claimed that the gunmen numbering about 20, stormed the Idris’ residence under a heavy downpour and shot sporadically into the air before abducting their victim in front of his second wife.

item.title: Not Anambra, Senate Tells Buhari Govt Where To Declare State Of Emergency
item.description: Weeks after the Attorney-General of the Federation, Abubakar Malami threatened a state of emergency in Anambra State, the upper legislative chambers has charged the Federal Government to immediately declare a state of emergency on all federal roads in the country. This was as the senators deliberated that “the deplorable state of the federal roads in Nigeria have become a national embarrassment as scores of innocent people are kidnapped by bandits, robbed, mutilated and killed daily in avoidable accidents on account of bad federal roads”.

item.title: APC Campaign Council Fixes Date To Hold Inaugural Meeting
item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC) Presidential Campaign Council has fixed a date for its inaugural meeting. Naija News gathered that the inaugural meeting would take place on Tuesday, October 4 at the PPC Headquarters in Abuja, the nation’s capital. A source told This Day that the meeting would involve all Directors and PCC leaders in all the states of the Federation. Recall that the ruling party had on September 28 scheduled a peace walk and prayers to officially kick off campaigns for the 2023 presidential election, but was suspended indefinitely.

item.title: Dbanj Takes Tough Action Against Rape Accuser, Miss Babatayo
item.description: Popular Nigerian musician, Oladapo Oyebanjo, also know as D’Banj, has asked Miss Seyitan Babatayo who accused him of raping her in a hotel room on December 30, 2018, to make a payment of N100m within 48 hours or face legal action. In a pre-litigation letter signed by his lawyer, Chief Mike Ozekhome (SAN) and addressed to Miss Babatayo’s lawyer, Ojoge, Omileye and Partners, dated June 15, 2020, D’banj also demanded that an apology be published in at least four national dailies.

item.title: Nakuru: Midnight funeral leaves Molo mourners cursing
item.description: - Joel Chepwony, the Kabianga location chief confirmed a 88-year-old man was buried at midnight at his home in Sachang'wan - The chief said the old man was buried with a mattress and his blanket as per his will - Chepkwony noted the deceased had declined to be interred in a casket leaving his family with no choice Residents of Molo, Nakuru county were left reeling in shock on Friday, October 25, after a 88-year -old man from Sachang’wan estate was buried in the middle of the night.

According to the Governor, he is more concerned about campaigning for the APC presidential flagbearer, Bola Tinubu, in the South East.

item.title: Sagay Speaks On Plan To Field Jonathan, Buni Under APC
item.description: The Chairman of the Presidential Advisory Corruption (PACAC), Itse Sagay, on Sunday warned former President Goodluck Jonathan against joining the All Progressives Congress. According to Sagay, Jonathan will be denigrating himself if joins the ruling APC ahead of the 2023 general elections. Sagay noted there is a plan to bring Jonathan into APC so that he would hand over to Yobe State Governor, Mai Mala Buni after serving for one term.

item.title: Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Sunday, 3rd April, 2022
item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today Sunday, 3rd April 2022. The Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) has blamed Governor Nasir El-Rufai for the killings and kidnapping rocking Kaduna State. The group stated that the Kaduna governor paying killer Fulani herdsmen some years back is the cause of the current carnage the north is witnessing. CAN was reacting to a statement by El-Rufai where he threatened to hire foreign mercenaries to help tackle insecurity in the state.

item.title: Umahi: We Remain Loyal To Our Party
item.description: Nigeria Governors elected on the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has stated that they remain loyal and committeed to strengthening the main opposition party. They made this known during the ongoing 90th NEC meeting of the party holding at the party’s National Secretariat, Wadata House, Abuja. Speaking on behalf of his colleagues, Chairman of the PDP Governors Forum, Aminu Tambuwal, stated that the party governors remain united .

item.description: NBC Connecticut anchor Heidi Voight has been noticeably missing from the broadcast for a while — is she OK? Here's what we know. One trusted morning news broadcast anchor in particular is Heidi Voight of NBC Connecticut.

item.title: What Happened to Oliver Lee? Peloton Has Scrubbed His FItness Content
item.description: What Happened to Oliver Lee on Peloton? All His On-Demand Content Was ScrubbedBy Distractify StaffApr. 30 2020, Updated 3:10 p.m. ET Source: Instagram / FacebookPeloton's digital content has been a respite for fitness-minded individuals trying to cope with stay-at-home orders amid the COVID-19 pandemic. With gyms shuttered across the country, people looking to stay active have relied on digital content on apps like Peloton Digital more than ever. So it didn't take long for subscribers to notice that all classes led by instructor Oliver Lee had been wiped from the app, leaving many scrambling to find out what happened to Oliver Lee at Peloton.

item.title: APC Grants Goodluck Jonathan Waiver To Contest Presidential Primary
item.description: The ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) has reportedly granted former President Goodluck Jonathan a waiver to contest the upcoming party’s presidential primary. Naija News learned that Jonathan was granted the waiver after meeting with the APC National Chairman, Senator Abdullahi Adamu, at the former President’s house in Abuja last week. Adamu was said to have met with Jonathan twice in one week to confirm if he is willing to contest for the APC presidential ticket at the special National Convention on Sunday.

item.description: Nigerian activist Reno Omokri has taken to the street alongside other Nigerians to ‘harass’ President Muhammadu Buhari out of New York. In a video posted via his Instagram handle with the hashtag #HarassBuhariOutOfNewyork, Reno is seen with other Nigerians on the street of New York protesting and complaining about the fall of Nigerian Naira. Reno also thanked everyone who came out to participate in the rally with him despite the presence of the police.

item.title: Court Orders Army To Release IPOB 'Sponsor'
item.description: The Federal High Court sitting in Port Harcourt has ordered the Nigerian Army to release Tochukwu Okeke who has been in detention since July 5 over allegation of sponsoring the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB and its militant wing, the Eastern Security Network, ESN. Justice Stephen Pam asked the Nigerian Army to release Okeke unconditionally. Naija News reports that the judge made the decision after hearing a fundamental right enforcement suit that was filed on his behalf by his lawyer, Chinedum Agwaramgbo.

item.title: Five People Dead As Romania Chopper Crashes
item.description: A helicopter crash in eastern Romania near the Black Sea on Wednesday left five soldiers dead while searching for a missing fighter jet and its pilot. The spokesman of the Ministry of National Defence, Gen Constantin Spanu, while speaking said, “Unfortunately, all five members of the IAR 330 crew lost their lives. Search and rescue operations for the pilot of the MiG 21 LanceR are still ongoing.” It was gathered that the IAR 330-Puma helicopter crashed in the area of Gura Dobrogei, 11 kilometres (seven miles) from the airfield.

item.title: Wrong To Tag IPOB Terrorist Group, S/East Marginalized
item.description: Elder statesman and Ijaw national leader, Chief Edwin Clerk, has condemned the proscription of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) by the federal government. Addressing stakeholders at the south-south zonal conference in Port Harcourt, Rivers state capital, on Friday, the south-south leader wondered why IPOB would be tagged a terrorist group when more dangerous groups in the north have not been tagged as such. Speaking further, Clark stated that the presence of five states in the south-east is a form of “injustice” when compared to the six states in other geopolitical zones and seven states in the north-west.

item.title: GOtv: Problems and solutions - Legit.ng
item.description: GOtv is possibly one of the best pay-TV services on the Nigerian market, but it still causes a lot of problems. Anyone who has ever used GOtv has inevitably run into one of the decoder malfunctions or irritating error codes. If you are one of these people, and you do not know what to do, continue reading below to find out the solutions to your GOtv problems. Here is a guide on how to clear those common GOtv errors.

item.title: Jennifer Veal - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Former teen actress who had her first adult role as Nanny Agatha on the Disney Channel series Jessie. She also runs a popular self-titled YouTube channel, which has earned over 170,000 subscribers. Before Fame She earned her West End stage debut at age 11 in a production of Chitty Chitty Bang Bang. Trivia She had her first recurring television role as Lucy on As the Bell Rings in 2007. Family Life She has an older brother named Tom.

item.title: Madam C.J. Walker - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Haircare marketer and the first female African-American millionaire. She founded Madam C. J. Walker Manufacturing Company. Before Fame She was a member of St. Paul AME Church. Trivia Her efforts to improve hair care for African-American women helped her to become a millionaire and were motivated by her own hair loss. Family Life She married Moses McWilliams in 1882, when she was 14 years old. They divorced in 1887 and she later remarried twice.

item.title: Simone Biles - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Gymnast who won four gold medals at the 2016 Olympics in the all-around, team, floor exercise and vault competitions. Through her success at the Olympics and in World Championship events, she has become one of the most decorated gymnasts in U.S. history. Before Fame She trained for thirty hours a week while still attending The Redd School. She won her first vault gold medal at the Jr. Visa Championships in 2012.

item.title: Who Is Charlie Puth Dating in 2021?
item.description: Is Charlie Puth dating any new lucky ladies in 2021? His relationship history is impressive enough, and he doesn't stay single for long. Source: Getty ImagesKeeping up with Charlie Puth's dating history has been pretty interesting over the years since he entered the music scene. Charlie’s initial exposure to fame came after he uploaded song covers to YouTube, a route similarly taken by other artists like Justin Bieber and Shawn Mendes.

item.title: Amidst Fight With Atiku, PDP, Ortom Predicts Party That Will Win Benue State
item.description: The Benue State Governor, Samuel Ortom has predicted that the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) will win all positions in the state during the 2023 elections. He urged the people of the state to go all out and work for the PDP in the forthcoming polls, adding that the All Progressives Congress (APC) has failed Nigerians. Naija News reports the Governor said this at the flag-off of the PDP senatorial campaigns in Benue South held at Pavilion Square in Oju Local Government Area of the state.

item.title: APC Reveals Buhari Stand On Zoning Presidential Ticket
item.description: The All Progressives Congress, APC has spoken on speculations indicating that President Muhammadu Buhari demanded that the presidency be zoned to a region. Some reports had earlier claimed that the president insisted that a flag-bearer from the South be selected. Buhari and the party leaders met with the aspirants at the State House in Abuja, Saturday night. Muhammad Nata’ala Keffi, spokesman to National Chairman, Abdullahi Adamu revealed via a statement on Sunday that the party did not discuss zoning.

item.title: Gareth McGrillen - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Bassist for the electronic rock band Pendulum and one half of the popular electronic music duo Knife Party. Before Fame He began his career in a very underground drum and bass scene. Trivia He is known for songs like "Internet Friends" and "Centipede." Family Life He grew up in Perth with his family. Associated With He and Rob Swire make up the duo Knife Party. ncG1vNJzZmivp6x7p63MqKysmpmnwamwwLKqZ5ufonyxsc6po55nl5a%2FpsDHZqScn6Keua2xzWefraWc

item.title: Jack Dylan Grazer - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actor who was cast as Eddie Kaspbrak in the 2017 horror film It, based on the Stephen King novel of the same name. Previously, he appeared in the 2015 horror comedy anthology film Tales of Halloween. In 2019, he starred in Shazam! Before Fame He made his small-screen acting debut in 2014 on the TV series The Greatest Event in Television History. Trivia In 2015, he was a guest star on the TV series Comedy Bang!

item.title: Ooni Of Ife Welcomes His New Queen, Olori Mariam Anako, Into The Palace
item.description: The Ooni Of Ife, Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi has welcomed his new wife, Olori Mariam Anako into the palace of the Oduduwa. Naija News reports that photos of the event, shared by Nigerian journalist Dele Momodu captured the beautiful moments. Some of the photos show the imperial majesty and his wife serving couple goals and others captured the moment when Ooni was praying for his wife. Ooni’s new marriage is coming barely seven months after his estranged wife, Naomi Silekunola announced their separation on social media.

item.title: 'Ive Not Seen That Person That Will Suspend Me In PDP'
item.description: The Minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Nyesom Wike on Wednesday dared the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to suspend him as a member of the party. He also added that no one in the PDP can discipline him, rather, he should be the one to discipline those who violated the party’s constitution on rotation. Wike spoke against the background of the crisis which rocked the PDP ahead of the 2023 presidential election in which he and some others popularly known as the G5 Governors worked against the party’s presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar.

item.title: Galina Becker - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: College track and field athlete turned model who is well known as the wife of wrestler Roman Reigns.  Before Fame In high school, she won regional titles in triple jump events and was named her school's MVP in her first 3 years, beginning as a freshman. Trivia She attended Georgia Tech University and competed in triple jump, hurdles and the 100 meter dash. Family Life She and Roman have a daughter named Joelle.

item.description: American actor known for his roles in Boogie Nights and Batman and Robin. He also starred in the soap opera The Young and the Restless. Before Fame He earned a B.A. in Art History at Princeton University in 1991. Trivia He has also worked as a successful painter and has had his work purchased by many celebrities. Family Life He married Elizabeth Berkley in 2003. Associated With He is the nephew of designer Ralph Lauren.

Hosted by popular talk show host Jimmy Fallon, That's My Jam pits pairs of celebrities together in music-themed challenges, some of which are derived from segments previously featured on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon.

item.title: 'Stop Doing Drugs' - Naira Marley Joins NDLEA Campaign Against Substance Abuse
item.description: Controversial Nigerian singer, Azeez Fashola, better known as Naira Marley, has warned fans and Nigerian youths to shun drug abuse. Naija News reports that the singer paid a visit to the Nigerian Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) chairman, Buba Marwa, at the agency’s headquarters in Abuja today, August 17, where he declared his support for the fight against substance abuse. Naira Marley, in a video shared by the NDLEA spokesperson, Femi Babafemi, via Twitter, urged Nigerians to stop all substance abuse, stressing it poses a threat to health.

item.title: Does Ben Warren Have Cancer? 'Station 19' Spoilers
item.description: Ben Warren's Latest Health Scare Has 'Station 19' Fans WorriedBy Anna QuintanaPublished May 20 2021, 2:52 p.m. ET Source: ABC/Ron BatzdorffSince Station 19 is a spinoff of Grey's Anatomy, it's no surprise when Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital makes a cameo. However, it often doesn't end too well for characters of the ABC drama. This time around, Ben Warren is the one on the operating table, after it was revealed that the surgical resident turned firefighter might have testicular cancer.

item.title: Air Force Bombards IPOBs Camps In Delta
item.description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) has bombarded the camps of the proscribed Indigenous People Of Biafra (IPOB) in Delta State. Speaking to reporters on Thursday, the Police Commissioner in the state, Muhammed Ari, confirmed that a security team led by the Air Force carried out the operation. Ari had said the police used a helicopter in the state capital around lllah to disperse members of IPOB and send a signal to them that the command is in charge.

item.title: Anthony Davis - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: NBA power forward/center who was drafted first overall in 2012 and spent his first seven NBA seasons with the New Orleans Hornets before a 2019 trade sent him to the Los Angeles Lakers. item.description: Mom Tried to Exploit Babysitter into Working for Almost NothingBy Robin ZlotnickUpdated Oct. 9 2019, 1:53 p.m. ET Source: iStock PhotoI never understand parents who don't want to pay their babysitters a fair wage. These are the people who are watching your children! Making sure they stay safe! Wouldn't you pay more to know that the person you hired is going to do a good job? But that's not how everyone thinks, clearly.

item.title: Kuna shindano mpya #Africanmumchallange, umeshiriki?
item.description: Mama Mwafrika sio kama mama mwingine. Mama wa Kiafrika anapenda sana kuongeza chumvi na anachukulia baadhi ya mambo kwa uzito na mengine kwa ucheshi. Kukua Afrika ni moja ya mambo ya kufurahisha sana maishani kwa mtoto yeyote. Ni jambo tusiloweza kujadiliana. Ukimzuia mama kukupiga kofi, huenda akapiga nduru na kusema kuwa ulikuwa ukijaribu kupigana naye. Haha! Ukiiba mnofu wa nyama ya kuku kutoka kwa sufuria, mama anakwambia wezi wote wa kitaalam walianza kama wezi wa kuku!

item.title: Mwalimu wa Shule ya Upili ya Maranda aliyetoweka apatikana ameaga dunia
item.description: - Kevin Otieno Ongoma aliripotiwa kupotea baada ya kutoka shuleni Ijumaa, Oktoba 9 - Polisi walifuatilia simu zake mbili na kufika hadi Mto Nzoia ambapo walipata gari lake aina ya Toyota likiwa limeegeshwa karibu na ukingo wa mto huo - Wapelelezi wanafuatilia kisa hicho ili kubaini endapo marehemu alijitoa uhai au aliuawa Mwalimu wa Shule ya Upili ya Maranda ambaye alipotea Oktoba 9 amepatikana amefariki dunia. Mwili wa Kevin Otieno Ongoma ulipatikana karibu na Mto Nzoia, Sio Port Ijumaa, Oktoba 23 na kutia kikomo shughuli ya wiki mbili ya kumsaka mwaili muyo wa Biologia.

item.title: These Luxury First Class Suites Will Make You Hate Flying Coach Even More
item.description: These Luxury First Class Suites Will Make You Hate Flying Coach Even MoreBy Mustafa GatollariUpdated Jan. 7 2019, 10:10 p.m. ET Source: youtubeFlying is the worst. item.description: Fun (and disturbing) statistics about your fave Disney princesses. Disney princesses are usually all the same: attractive, skinny and heterosexual (although that's debatable). For example, one out of 11 people are shoplifters, which means at least one Disney princess has secretly lifted a lip gloss from Sephora. My bet's on Ariel as we all know she has a hoarding problem.

item.title: 2023 Presidency: Obi May Not Even Come Third
item.description: Anambra State Governor, Charles Soludo has warned the Labour Party (LP) presidential candidate, Peter Obi, that he may lose the 2023 election by a wide margin. Speaking on Monday in a statement titled “History Beckons and I will not be Silent”, Soludo submitted that those encouraging Obi that he can win an election without a structure are only deceiving him. Though the Anambra Governor said he wishes Obi would emerge victorious at the polls, realities on the ground are not in his favour.

item.title: Army Rescues Another Chibok Schoolgirl, Now A Mother
item.description: The Nigerian Army on Thursday revealed that another kidnapped Chibok girl has been rescued from captivity. According to the Nigerian Army, the rescued girl, Hauwa Joseph and her baby were found on Tuesday while on a patrol in Borno state and are currently in a military medical facility. Earlier on Wednesday, the Nigerian Army said it found one Mary Ngoshe who is believed to be one of the girls kidnapped from GGSS, Chibok, in 2014.

item.title: JET-A1, Others May Push Flight Above N100,000 Domestic Airline Operators
item.description: The base economy flight ticket might be increased to N100,000 by domestic airlines under the aegis of the Airline Operators of Nigeria due to the aviation fuel price hikes. The spokesperson for local airlines/Chairman, United Airlines, Professor Obiora Okonkwo revealed this in an interview with Punch on Wednesday. According to Okonkwo, local operators are being compelled to source foreign exchange from the parallel market at high rates due to a lack of adequate supply from the Central bank of Nigeria via the commercial banks.

item.title: Whitemoney Reveals Why Married People Should Not Be In BBNaija

item.title: 15 best 90s anime movies and TV shows that have become iconic
item.description: Thanks to shows like South Park, The Simpsons, and Family Guy, animated films and TV shows are no longer a preserve for children. For years, grownups have enjoyed the vibrant colors, fantastic themes and exceptional storylines that this genre offers. Therefore, we take a trip down memory lane to review some of the best 90s anime movies and TV shows that still hold up today. Over the years, the quality of anime shows has improved greatly.

item.title: Adamu Reacts To Impeachment Threat Against Buhari
item.description: The National Chairman of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC), Abdullahi Adamu, has condemned the recent threat by the minority lawmakers in the National Assembly to impeach President Muhammadu Buhari. Recall that minority lawmakers in the Senate had last week given President Buhari six weeks to address the general insecurity in the country or risk impeachment. The PDP caucus in the House of Representatives also joined in the six-week ultimatum after a meeting of the National Assembly PDP caucus.

Trivia In 2002, she won the prestigious Billboard Latin Music Estrella Award, which honored her influential role in Latin music. Family Life She raised a daughter named Diana Alejandra Araujo from a previous relationship.

item.title: Daddy Freeze Reveals Who Helped Burna Boy
item.description: Nigerian OAP, Daddy Freeze has reacted to Nigerian singer, Burna Boy’s recent Grammy award nomination. Freeze in a post on his Instagram page on Wednesday, November 25, said the person that deserves his congratulatory message for Burna Boy’s nomination is his mother who according to him have sacrificed everything just to see her son at the peak. The media personality further acknowledged that the singer has amazing skills and talent that cannot be left out.

A group of 15 singles convenes in a Las Vegas villa, pairing up in hopes of hitting it off in the face of some serious drama and unexpected plot twists that can be attributed to the producers.

item.title: Richard Mofe Damijo's son weds
item.description: Oghenekome Mofe, son of prominent Nollywood actor, Richard Mofe-Damijo popularly called RMD walked down the aisle with his sweetheart, Eniola Abiodun on Saturday. The event held at the Chapel of Christ The Light Church, Alausa, Ikeja with the reception following immediately at  Grandeur Event Center, Oregun. The colourful wedding was graced by celebrities as Teju Babyface, Bovi, Ali baba, Okey Bassi and others. Also in attendance was the Gov of Delta State and his wife, the wife of the deputy gov of Delta State, members of the Delta State executive counsel and kings.

item.title: Police Officer Caught Beating Civilian With Cutlass Dismissed
item.description: An officer of the Nigerian Police Force seen in a viral video beating a civilian with cutlass has been relieved from service, Naija News reports. Nigerians have expressed anger and called for justice after the erring officer, PC Liyomo Okoi, was spotted in the video clip which went viral on July 31, 2022. Last week, the Inspector General of Police (IGP), Usman Alkali Baba expressed interest in the case and summoned Liyomo to his office in Abuja.

item.description: Kelsea Ballerini Is Remotely Hosting CMT Music Awards Following Positive COVID-19 TestBy Michelle SteinPublished April 11 2022, 4:05 p.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesAhead of April 11, 2022, Kelsea Ballerini and Anthony Mackie were slated to host the CMT Music Awards — that is, until some last-minute shuffling of plans resulted in a plan for the country singer to carry out her hosting duties remotely. item.title: Nigerians To Pay More For Electricity Starting From July
item.description: Indications are that Nigerians may pay 40 % more for electricity tariffs by the start of July 2023. Naija News reported that this development is coming about two weeks after President Bola Tinubu declared the end of the fuel subsidy regime during his inauguration. This platform understands that the increase would eventually lead to the end of all forms of energy subsidy in the country. According to The Guardian, with a monthly subsidy of about N50 billion still in the electricity sector owing to revenue shortfall, the tariff hike due from July 1, may be another acid test for the President Bola Ahmed Tinubu administration’s market reform.

item.title: One-year-old Pupil Dies After Being Flogged 31 Strokes Of Cane
item.description: A one-year-old baby in kindergarten identified as Obinna has died after his proprietor flogged him 31 strokes of cane. Sahara Reporters earlier stated that the boy who is a pupil of Arise and Shine Nursery and Primary School, Asaba, Delta State was flogged for playing with water and getting wet. Obinna’s hands and legs were reportedly tied by the owner of the school and her son before flogging him into a coma.

item.title: Trouble Looms As Moves To Stop Bawa's Confirmation As EFCC Boss Thickens
item.description: The planned Senate confirmation of the new Chairman-designate of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, Abdulrasheed Bawa, has suffered a setback. Naija News reports that a lawyer, Osuagwu Ugochukwu, has filed a suit before the Federal High Court in Abuja seeking to stop the Senate confirmation of the chairman-designate. The court document marked FHC/ABJ/CS/196/2021 was received at the Office of the Senate President on Thursday, according to an acknowledgment copy obtained by The PUNCH on Friday.

item.title: 836 Teachers Fired In Edo State
item.description: A total of 836 teachers have been sacked by the Edo State Government following a verification exercise carried out by the department of Information and Communication Technology. The affected teachers learnt of the sack when they discovered that their names were missing from the December salary voucher. Those sacked were found to have overstayed, mentally unstable, physically blind and have falsified their age and credentials. A man who gave his name as Osahon said his wife was affected.

item.title: Adeleke's Aide, Senator Basiru Trade Words Over Clash At Eid-el-Kabir Praying Ground
item.description: Following the drama over the seating arrangement at a prayer ground located in the Oke-Baale area in Osogbo, the Osun State capital, former Senate spokesman, Senator Ajibola Basiru; and the spokesman for Governor Ademola Adeleke, Olawale Rasheed, have traded blame. Appearing as guests on Channels Television’s Politics Today on Wednesday night, Rasheed and Basiru disagreed on what transpired at the prayer ground. Speaking, Basiru, who lost his re-election to the 10th Senate, claimed some thugs rough-handled him and ordered him to vacate where he was positioned for the Eid prayers.

He runs his own YouTube channel under the name KidBehindACamera and also has a TikTok account under the username kidbehindacamerahere. He was featured in the "THE HALLOWEEN WHOPPER PRANK!" video which has received over 27 million views.  Before Fame The filming of Angry Grandpa began in 2008 on a to-be-suspended YouTube channel before TheAngryGrandpaShow channel came to be.

item.title: LP, AAC Fume As Tinubu Government Unveils Plan To Spend N3 Billion On Luxury Properties Seized By EF
item.description: The Labour Party (LP) and the African Action Congress (AAC) have berated the President Bola Tinubu-led Federal Government for earmarking N3bn for the renovation of two luxury Abuja properties forfeited to the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC). Naija News reports that the properties located in the Guzape and Mabushi areas of the Federal Capital Territory are part of several illegally acquired assets and proceeds of money laundering recovered by the EFCC.
